title: Safeguards
instructions: Organise the safeguards into a logical order for taking on a new client

explanation:
1. Notify relevant parties
2. Obtain consent to act for them
3. Use separate engagement teams
4. Prevent access to information
5. Clear guidelines for team on security and confidentiality
6. Confidentiality agreements
7. Regular review of safeguards

title: IR35 deemed salary proforma
instructions: Drag the lines into the correct order to build the IR35 deemed salary proforma for PSC providing services to a small company. Whole-line matching only.
lines_json: [{"line_id":"S4","text":"Less employer's NIC on actual payments","is_distractor":false},{"line_id":"S7","text":"Employer's NIC on gross deemed payment (G × 13.8/113.8)","is_distractor":false},{"line_id":"S1","text":"Income from relevant engagements","is_distractor":false},{"line_id":"D1","text":"Less employee's NIC on actual payments","is_distractor":true},{"line_id":"S6","text":"Gross amount of deemed payment","is_distractor":false},{"line_id":"S3","text":"Less salary/benefits paid to worker","is_distractor":false},{"line_id":"S2","text":"Less statutory 5% deduction","is_distractor":false},{"line_id":"S5","text":"Less expenses allowable under employment income","is_distractor":false},{"line_id":"D2","text":"Less PAYE already deducted from the worker","is_distractor":true},{"line_id":"S8","text":"Actual deemed payment to worker","is_distractor":false}]
explanation:
This proforma calculates the deemed employment payment under IR35 by starting with income from relevant engagements, deducting statutory/allowed items to reach the gross deemed payment (G), then computing employer NIC on G and arriving at the actual deemed payment to the worker.

1. Income from relevant engagements
2. Less statutory 5%
3. Less salary/benefits paid to worker
4. Less employer's NIC on actual payments
5. Less expenses allowable under employment income
6. Gross amount of deemed payment (G)
7. Employer's NIC on gross deemed payment (G x 13.8/113.8)
8. Actual deemed payment to worker

title: EIS investor checklist
instructions: Drag the statements into the most logical order for an individual making (and later exiting) a qualifying EIS investment
explanation:
This proforma captures the main EIS subscription conditions, the income tax relief mechanics and timing, and the key holding-period/disposal consequences.

1. Ensure the investor is not ‘connected’ (not an employee and does not own >30% share capital)
2. Subscribe in cash for newly issued ordinary shares (irreedeemable and fully paid up), 
3. At investment date, investor must not hold other shares in the company (except existing EIS/SEIS holdings), 
4. Claim EIS income tax relief as a tax reducer (up to £1,000,000 subscriptions; lower of 30% subscription or IT liability), 
5. Hold the shares for at least 3 years to avoid withdrawal of relief, 
6. Remember claim deadline: by 5th anniversary of normal SA filing date for the tax year of investment (e.g., 31 Jan 2031 for 2024/25), 
7. Consider CGT position on disposal: after 3 years, gain is exempt; loss is allowable with cost reduced by net EIS relief not withdrawn

title: Medium/large PSC IR35 process
instructions: Drag the lines into the correct order describing the IR35 process for services provided by a PSC to a medium or large entity (whole-line matching only).
explanation:
for medium/large entities the client determines status and issues an SDS (with a 45-day challenge window), operates PAYE/NIC on the DDP, and the DDP is used to prevent double taxation when the PSC later remunerates the individual.

1. Client determines whether IR35 rules apply (medium/large entity engagement), 
2. Client issues a Status Determination Statement (SDS) with reasons, 
3. Individual can challenge the SDS before final payment; client must respond within 45 days, 
4. Client operates PAYE/NIC on the deemed direct payment (DDP) as if PSC were a direct employee, 
5. PSC receives the fee net of tax withheld by the client; the net fee is non-taxable to PSC, 
6. When PSC later pays salary/dividends, remuneration is free of PAYE/NIC up to the level of the DDP (to avoid double taxation)

title: Medium/large PSC IR35 process
instructions: Drag the lines into the correct order for calculating the deemed direct payment for services provided by a PSC to a medium or large entity (whole-line matching only).
explanation:
Client will withold income tax and Class 1 Employee NICs on DDP as if the individual was an employee. PSC receives fee net of tax and drawings are net of tax up to the limit of the DDP. 

1. Payment for services (net VAT), 
2. (Direct cost of materials), 
3. (Allowable expenses), 
4. Deemed direct payment (DDP)
